channel.title: RSbots.net is not safe
channel.description:
Just a warning to anyone who uses rsbots.net's bot client, I'm just about 100% sure it was used to get my password. About 120m in cash + items was taken from my account this afternoon.
I do not download [i]anything[/i] unless I know it is a 100% trusted source, and in fact I'm usually too paranoid when it comes to what gets put on my machine. rsbots.net is really the only way my password could have been taken.
I take full responsibility for trusting them with my password, but honestly I have been using them for quite a long time and they are known for being trustworthy.
Anyways, just an FYI for any of you who use them, there is a chance your shit will get jacked.

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe

@SETO wrote:

sameshit with rsbuddy…alot of rants with their script database …and password stealings

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:40, topic:392128”]Rsbots.net didn’t do it rsbuddy are known as their founders are scammers lol.

Want to keep your account safe? Bank pin and login with your bot so you not need to type in your pw and you can just play on the bot client;).

I dont play rs anymore but yeah, I didn’t mind the funny mouse icon if anything it was usefull telling me things I never even knew would help me :)[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @MjExotic MjExotic
item.description:
@MjExotic wrote:

There are Virus these days the Steals Bot information.
Like Some Stealers Go and take you Data.db Which is the file that your information is saved in For rsbots.net (or Nexus completely)

As for Powerbot and Epicbot. they use your RSbot_accounts.ini file to decrypt it.
So yeah just be careful of what you download.

Read full topic

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @Christiaan Christiaan
item.description:
@Christiaan wrote:

[quote=“Mixxed, post:38, topic:392128”]Guys, this most likely does not have to do anything with the Nexus Client. The makers of the Nexus Client are an official company and have a network of thousands of “players”. They gain enough money to not have to care about in-game gold. And to be honest 120 million is not a lot for a botter + there are many exploits for the recover a stolen account/ recover a lost password.
And honestly keyloggers often are undetectable. They have custom stubs and as such are undetectable for the anti-virus software you own.[/quote]
so take a bank PIN

Read full topic

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @Mixxed Mixxed
item.description:
@Mixxed wrote:

Guys, this most likely does not have to do anything with the Nexus Client. The makers of the Nexus Client are an official company and have a network of thousands of “players”. They gain enough money to not have to care about in-game gold. And to be honest 120 million is not a lot for a botter + there are many exploits for the recover a stolen account/ recover a lost password.
And honestly keyloggers often are undetectable. They have custom stubs and as such are undetectable for the anti-virus software you own.

Read full topic

item.description:

Marine5287:

Ummm I think that’s illegal because you must pay them for their bots(RSBuddy ftw). I think it was something else because if that website did that, they’d be forced to shut down their site. Also someone could take legal action against them. Run a scan on your computer for keyloggers.

Legal action? That thing Jagex should have taken on them 5 years ago?

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I’m going to say this once and only once. Rsbot does NOT in anyway steal your password nor has it ever, the reason some of you had problems with it is because you downloaded something in the past that scanned your Rsbot and took the password. This is YOUR fault for not being safer and in NO way Rsbot’s fault.

Read full topic

item.title: RSbots.net is not safe
item.dc:creator: @rant rant
item.description:
@rant wrote:

we all learned a lesson with rsbot, DON’T USE 3rd PARTY BOTS! use only the bots provided to you by rsbot.net i highly doubt anyone has bugged the actual rsbot (unless you got it from an outside source).[quote=“k0 twin, post:20, topic:392128”][quote author=tL link=topic=489292.msg3577883#msg3577883 date=1303573756]
Running a virus scan to try and detect a way they steal your details is a bit silly. Your virus scanner won’t be able to pick up on the bit of code used to pluck your password and send it off.
[/quote]
I didn’t mean to detect anything within the bot, I ran the virus scan to see if I had a third party virus or something.[/quote]
you can’t detect a keygen in java…

Read full topic
